oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Resource efficiency of organic and low input systems in comparison to intensive agriculture
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Thorup-Kristensen, Kristian
Brennan, Mary
Halberg, Niels
Cooper, Julia
Lampkin, Nic
Niggli, Urs
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Biodiversity and ecosystem services
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: QLIF researchers have collected data on the environmental and economic impact of a series of production measures. This will be the basis for this workshop which aims to analyse the efficiency of organic and low-input systems concerning the use of land, nutrients, water energy, and climate change scenarios. Economic efficiency of different production systems with implication for markets and prices will be analysed. Furthermore, we will explore to which extend consumers value environmental benefits.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Thorup-Kristensen, Kristian; Brennan, Mary; Halberg, Niels; Cooper, Julia; Lampkin, Nic and Niggli, Urs (2008) Resource efficiency of organic and low input systems in comparison to intensive agriculture. Paper at: 4th QLIF Congress in the Frame of the 16th IFOAM Organic World Congress and the 2nd ISOFAR Conference, Modena, Italy, June 19-20, 2008.
